intro: Pasania spicata, commonly known as the spike pasania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with a fine pubescence. Pasania spicata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
